page.title: 20Scotton - St. Genewys Church
page.content: Scotton parish church,{St.Genewys}, is an attractive building in coursed limestone rubble with concrete tiled roofs.Dating from 12C,13C,15C and 16C it was restored in{1866}and all the fittings are 19C.The church has a tower,nave,North and South aisles and chancel.The East window is 19C stained glass;all the other windows are plain glass except for a small one in the East wall of the South aisle.In the church there is a 13C recumbent effigy of a knight,a 15C effigy of a lady and a 15C priest's grave slab.The church is in a good state of repair inside and out.The interior was redecorated by{Manpower Services Commission}in 1983.The churchyard is well kept. {************************************} Survey written by children of Scotter School,members of Scotter and Scotton W.I. and local people.
